security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and AI instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond documentation files. Contains code examples for educational purposes only.

content.user_title: Review Django code with strict correctness checks
content.value_statement: Code reviews often miss subtle correctness issues, especially around multi-tenant safety and data integrity. This skill provides a structured, hyper-pedantic review framework that catches correctness bugs, SOLID violations, and security risks before they reach production.
actual_capabilities: Reviews Django code with correctness-first priority
Checks multi-tenant scoping and time dimension invariants
Validates SOLID principle compliance with specific patterns
Flags security issues including permission checks and PII handling
Identifies performance problems like N+1 queries
limitations: Requires context about repository structure for full effectiveness
Does not execute tests or run static analysis tools directly
Focuses on backend code patterns, not frontend or infrastructure

use_cases.title: PR Review for Django Apps
use_cases.description: Review PRs for dashboard, survey, or optimo apps with focus on data integrity and multi-tenant safety

use_cases.title: Code Quality Standards
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent code quality standards across the team with structured severity-tagged feedback

use_cases.title: Migration Safety Checks
use_cases.description: Validate Django migrations for downtime safety and large-table schema change risks

prompt_templates.title: Full Pedantic Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Complete review with all severity levels
prompt_templates.prompt: Use your monty-code-review skill to review this Django PR like Monty would, and be fully pedantic with your usual severity tags

prompt_templates.title: Quick Pass
prompt_templates.scenario: Skip minor nits, focus on blockers
prompt_templates.prompt: Use your monty-code-review skill to skim this PR and only flag blocking or should-fix issues; skip most nits

prompt_templates.title: Migration Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use monty-code-review to check this Django migration for downtime risks and large-table column additions

prompt_templates.title: SOLID Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for SOLID principle violations, specifically Dependency Inversion and Single Responsibility

output: What is great: Good use of transaction.atomic around export generation
BLOCKING: dashboardapp/views/v2/report.py - queryset missing organization scoping, risks cross-tenant leakage
SHOULD_FIX: pulse_iq/tasks.py - potential N+1 when iterating over responses
NIT: utils/date_helpers.py - docstring could clarify quarter definition, missing newline at EOF
Tests: Missing coverage for multi-tenant edge cases
Verdict: Request changes due to blocking multi-tenant issue

best_practices: Provide PR descriptions and ticket context for more focused reviews
Use severity tags to prioritize fixes effectively
Apply SOLID checks early when designing new services
Run the skill on migrations before deploying to production
anti_patterns: Skipping reviews for small PRs to avoid correctness bugs
Merging code with BLOCKING multi-tenant issues
Adding new platform support via if/elif chains instead of registry patterns
Using tight coupling that requires extensive @patch calls in tests

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude, Claude Code, and OpenAI Codex with platform-specific invocation commands

faq.question: How strict is the default review?
faq.answer: The default review is hyper-pedantic, flagging style nits in addition to correctness issues. Request a lighter pass to skip most NIT items

faq.question: Can I use this for non-Django code?
faq.answer:: The skill is optimized for Django/Python backends but can provide general code review guidance for other codebases

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-only skill that operates within your AI tool. Code reviewed stays in your environment

faq.question: Why are my tests failing in prod but passing locally?
faq.answer: The skill can check for mock/prod divergence including LSP violations where mocks return richer shapes than production code

faq.question: How does this compare to standard code review tools?
faq.answer: This skill complements tools like ruff or flake8 by catching semantic issues and architectural patterns that linters cannot detect
